comments.body: But villagers can't rebuild. If this happens, the village will be completely destroyed.
Reasonable

I think this would be too much trouble, since they would cause some serious destruction regardless of if you defeat them. However, it seems reasonable to be able to destroy some blocks if they can't pathfind in the village, like if the player builds an indestructable wall around the village.

Going by Element Animation Logic, I imagine a lot of Villagers screaming "MY WOOD!!!!" if this becomes a thing.

It's a bit gimmicky but I can see it happening. Really nice idea regardless of everything.
"I'm gonna go steal that guy's wood, who really likes wood."

Too much griefing. This would be especially troublesome for players who want to keep villages (considering raids can occur to player-made villages as well). If to add challenges to raids, maybe bring in illusioners or other illager types to the waves.
maybe a unnamed one, so if you name it in an anvil, it can turn into an existing one.
OOF, to sad that they're removing the goat horns tbh.

I saw that a villager wanted boats. I had a texture pack on, so thought it was asking for bowls. I didn’t know that they didn’t ask for bowls so I crafted two stacks of bowls. I wish this was a thing. Maybe for fishermen as a level three or four trade, because bowls can be obtained through fishing.
please vote for this it's good idea and with bridges between the trees is very good
this is actually really cool! Make them like the oompa loompa houses and dress them in cloth or leaves!
Totally ruins the purpose of the deep dark, and the warden is not a protector, and also it's blind.
bruh . warden is a hostile mob
already the guardian is not a protector he is hostile but the dark villages are a good idea
the ancient cities are abandoned

It would be at least consistent with the game's current workings, personally, I'd like for an automation approach without using villages for farming and fishing, but I do try to make use of what I got for sure.
Absolutely. Gives you more time to attack.

I completely agree. I think it is worth adding something to the mansion that will prevent the player from freely using the beds of illagers besides the inscription "you cannot sleep while there are monsters nearby." Perhaps the bedrooms will be on the highest floor, in the center of the layout. So it won't be of any use when the player gets there.
good idea but were you using herobrine as an example?
Oh wow that's a fun one!

This is a great idea to add more power to the village. However the villager guard and evoker should sell things too. The evokers could sell totems for 32 emeralds Or so and the guard should sell pumpkins and iron so you can make a golem from the items he gives you (I also have really bad luck finding pumpkins so this will help)

Yeah I wanted to put in trade ideas, but well I felt it would be best to keep the idea as simple as possible.

My original before shortening idea had things like the guards selling anything golem related, and the evoker having a few unique items.

These being as follows for the evoker.

Vex pod
info: "throw" to spawn some allied vexes to fight for you. Lasts 4 minutes despawns when time is up. this is a type of splash potion. spawns 2 vexes for potion potion its self is only there on max level.

Trap jaw
info: a floor trap item, when anything steps on it a pair of golem jaws snap closed dealing damage.

Other then that it would trade magical themed items.

La idea esta genial, pero creo que los illager zombis que sean vindicadores o saqueadores, se deberían convertir en aldeanos guardias (que podrían tener hachas o ballestas, y tendrían una camisa como la del vindicador pero del color de la del aldeano) y los evocadores y brujas en una especie de curandero mágico (que podría tener la vestimenta de un aldeano pero con sombrero de bruja y la línea dorada del evocador), las variantes zombis de evocador y bruja deberían ser extremadamente raras.

Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.  

 

Title: “The Woodman Villager”  

 

Text: “

Hello everyone I have an idea for a new villager and as in the title says is the Woodman

this villager would exchange objects or items according to his name obviously this villager would have as a work table a work table I know that is not very unique but I could not think of anything else, this villager appeared in a large village just like a blacksmith, his clothes would be that he walks a cap gridded red with black just like his T-shirt boots and a blue trousers , your house would be pure trunks of the biome in which it, its exchanges would be :

NOVATO : its exchange of 1 emerald would give you a maximum of 10 wooden logs (according to its biome) and wooden planks (32) will give you an emerald.

 

LEARN : he would give for 5 emeralds 20 trunks of a random biome and for 30 trunks of his respective biome would give you 3 emeralds.

 

TRAVELER : for 3 emeralds I gave you 20 buds of their respective biome and for a wooden axe I gave you 2 emeralds.

 

EXPERT : for 20 emeralds you will give an enchanted iron axe with efficiency 1, 2 or 3 and for 30 shoots of a random biome will give you 5 emeralds.

 

Thank you for reading my idea I hope you'll tell me what you think :D.” 

- Translated by Admin
Tola
I love this idea! It would help me out so much without being overpowered!
Great idea!
There are already iron golems for that.
And villagers can't fight for their lives, I think something like this has been posted.
There's already a way to make them immune to becoming zombified it's a command called immunetozombification
There's an nbt tag for those that can prevent them from turning into zombies when in the overworld.
I thought this was a bug report mistakenly posted here. I do support this idea, but I think it should be an easter egg like jeb_ sheep instead of just naming one anything.

I've always wanted the option to properly look like a villager. These could be simple head swaps and things like piglin's ears and villager's nose could be coded to utilise the second layer. Making them optional and adding more customization. Not to mention the Villager model would also let people look like Pillagers. Which would also be super fun.
Great idea
I think that, if implemented correctly, this idea would be very fun to play with, also, inn be like your pun
This would also tell a story for the underwater ships from the update aquatic. maybe villages could have ports and fishermen would work there
how about when making a ship into a SHIP, you should get a special block or something to let the game know you are not just creating a decoration. and the basic structure should look like a ship.
Que buena idea pero yo me basaria un poco en el oror de minecraft
Me basé en eso. El oro en Minecraft es más débil que el hierro, pero las herramientas son más rápidas.
bro i literally just thought of the same thing today but less damage
I'd like the Badlands Villagers.
No they should spawn in the new grimstone layer of caves!
You can repair the iron golem with iron bars, this feature is already in the game
You can? I'll have to try that.
I just tried it. It does not work. At least not in Bedrock edition.
It is only on java because mojang studios didn't put it on bedrock.
It's only in Java edition. He should change the title, so it says bedrock.
395280030152 bruh it’s iron ingots not iron bars
This is already a thing. You just use iron ingots and they heal.
It is on Bedrock! What version are you playing? Windows? Console Legacy?
Is it updated to at least 1.16? I know it's been in Bedrock since at least 1.16

They do need more trades, I wouldn't mind seeing some that were for items either for emeralds or for other items, like 10 birch saplings for 1 dark oak sapling, or 10 pufferfish for a potion of water breathing.
I would like to see other trades like player heads sniffer eggs, or reinfoced deepstlate at an expensive price
I like this idea except for the zombified piglins becoming hostile when you get The Nether Drifter.

Having features like a player joining the piglins or whatever is a pretty decent idea in itself, however, making zombie piglins be angry at you doesn't make much sense since the zombie piglins don't attack the piglins.
That was the only trade off I could think of to balance it. Do you have any other balance ideas for it?
no, because you don't need them. Hero of the village has no downsite either.
These may also be called Sandmen
They may drop Sleep Dust, which could be used to make sleep potions or blocks used to get to Dream/Nightmare Dimensions
Zombies may be able to turn into these

These may be creatures in the various Nightmare/Dream Dimension posts. Because there are already a lot if humanoid monsters in the overworld I would prefer if these only spawned in their own dimension
They could be passive when awake and hostile while asleep. Brilliant idea!
Don't witches heal the Illagers as well?
sure you don't hears of witch

I have heard of the witch, it’s just that the witch only spawns with Illagers in raids, whilst these spawn in woodland mansions, they don’t just heal the Illagers in certain amounts, but fully, they are more tactical than witches, and if the Illagers are not damaged, he overheals them, plus, if there are no Illagers within range, he does the opposite of healing you.
nice idea but I think the percentage should be higher. that would be very hard to get... not many players would be able to get one. it is like the rarity in winning the lottery.
I think this is in Minecraft Dungeons... but taking it to Minecraft would be really fun!!!!
